reviewText:
The Haunted Hells Reach is a third person action horror cooperative game. The goal is to liberate cursed places and survive the assault from the minions of Hell.
Four game modes are offered: Survival, Battle, Demonizer and Inferno. Each mode can be played on any of The Haunted’s eight maps.
Survival simply makes you keep fighting until you die, which is not a particularly engaging objective, while Battle and Demonizer are The Haunted’s efforts at player-versus-player modes. In Inferno, which is the best mode of the game, four players must survive four waves of enemies that increase in number and power over time before fighting Abaddon, a huge boss monster in a separate Hell level.
The player is equiped with a handgun, shotgun, machine gun and knife. You will unlock upgrades to these as you kill.
The game has also a deep melee system that gives the player an easy way out when surrounded by undead.
Unfortunately, networking issues can make locating or connecting to someone’s game difficult. The biggest problem of The Haunted Hells Reach is that joining a game forces you to wait until the next wave of enemies, which can sometimes be 10+ minutes until you can finally play.
in my opinion, if you are seeking a new, unique team-based game to play with some friends, The Haunted Hells Reach is a worthy choice.

reviewText:
This is your generic type of humans versus waves of zombies/monsters type scenario. It is very special, but it is definitely something good to come back to every once in awhile.

This is a third person shooter and it has a nice variety of weapons. You can upgrade your weapon for it to level up to the next tier. The tier system is, however, opinionated on which is better or worse. Regardless, it's a nice take  on a weapon system.

The monsters are demons, which has a variety of types out there. you'll have the generic not zombie but still cannon fodder like a zombie type monster, then you got the generic winged demon. You got the big orc like guys and then you got these weird tiny bug like things. The diversity is good. There is a type of giant demon that eventually becomes immune to gun damage, whom encourages melee combat since that's the only way to kill it.

Speaking of melee combat, you have not just the primary weapons or sidearms, but also a melee weapon with different melee attacks like kicking. You probably will not use them all a whole lot, but it's still a worthy try in variety that I wish more games would have. (I miss kicking in games greatly)

When you finish the waves, you eventually fight the final boss. The final boss feels cheap at first, but it's possible with practice. It basically is a giant ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of a demon that walks around in lava, throwing lava ♥♥♥♥ at you, all the meanwhile the immune to gun damage guys spawn all over the place trying to attack you while bursts of lava comes out of the ground. It is a climatic ending and it was climatic at first, but it gets old after awhile... like the game itself.

As I have said before, the game is something you'll wanna come back to every once in awhile, especially with friends. Its graphics are good and so is the lighting, not amazing but good enough, the sound is what you'd want, the characters are kinda over the top in personality like a bad horror movie- which is a good thing - and their design is nice.

There is a variety of game modes, one of which you can play in a strategy game like perspective and spawn enemies or even choose to play as the enemy yourself. It isn't that fun in my opinion to be the bad guys because you'll die so quickly and you have a spawn timer on when you can spawn more enemies, which might be good for balance and fairness for the humans but it makes you feel bored just sitting there pressing the button over and over again... even cookie clicker is more fun than that. There is a survival mode as well, it's as you'd expect and it's fun as well.

Overall, the game is good. I wouldn't buy it full price, I would consider buying it on sale for around $5. Apparently the developers are hinting something is afoot with the title. We'll see what that means and I'll edit my review accordingly if it any way changes my overall opinion. For now, this is a good bargin title, don't buy it at full price.

Pros:
A good enough variety in enemies and weapons
Lighting and atmosphere is nice
Gameplay is fun for beginners and veterans alike
A healthy amount of gamemodes

Cons:
Not many hours should be expected to be put in this right away, but it is something you could launch for years to come in every five or so months. This game will get stale pretty quick.
The combat seems unbalanced, you could spam some moves and do just fine



Overall, I give it a score of a 6ish/10. For people that are unfamiliar with rating scales, 6 isn't bad.

reviewText:
This is definitely a unknown and severely underestimated gem.
It's nothing terribly fance. Just a very action-packed, quick and arcade-y 'kill everything before it kills you' type arena survival shooter. The gameplay itself consist of a mix of gunplay and melee action, combined with tons of explosives (and explosions) and a life-saving dodge mechanic.
If you like L4D or Killing Floor, but feel that both those games have slow player characters and are not action-heavy enough, give Haunted a try.

Be warned though, Haunted is definitely on a higher difficulty level then any of the two compared games. Whilst on the lowest of the 5 difficulty grades you might easily survive the first of the four waves, the later ones will usually kill you on your first attempt, with suicidal green-goo spitting maniacs, walking volcanos and Freddy-style nightmare warriors.
And if we start about the highest difficulty level... boy... imagine L4D expert realism with 80% of all infected being special infected :P

The pros of Haunted are clear: Solid gameplay, tons of action and reflex-based thinking, mixed with a solid note of badassery.
However, I must be fair and mention it's downsides too: There is no character progression, any weapon upgrades you gather in a match are reverted at the end of a level. As well, there's literally no online playerbase for this game. This really isn't a bad thing and I enjoy it a lot in singleplayer, but if you are the coop only type of person, you may want to bring some friends. Lastly, it lacks diversity and is one of those games you just cant play 8 hours in a row or you will grow bored.


Overall, Haunted is one of my longest-active games, simply because it's always fun to relax with techno/speedcore battle music via winampw hilst playing a round or two on Nightmare difficulty. Whenever I feel like blowing faces up, I just grab winamp, Haunted, and splode away.
Rating: 8/10

This game has been quite the mix of feelings for me. On the one hand it's good for some laughs, the weapons get progressivly more awesome the more you upgrade them and the Demonizer gamemode is pretty cool when you want to just be a giant jerk and summon minions on your former teammates should you die or kill yourself (much like I do just to summon junk). On the other hand, the laughs start to fade after about 15 minutes, it's very repetitive and the game knows exactly when and where to become an absolutly evil ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ about everything.

This game heavily focuses on teamwork (Teamwork being the key word) and at times, almost demands you to play with others as opposed with playing solo which would be ok if it wasn't for the fact that:

1. playing on your own is both boring and tedious and

2. there's no one to help you whatsoever should things go wrong and odds are, they probably will.

That's not to say that playing solo is entirely bad. If that's your thing, you go right ahead and do it, but be prepared for a letdown the further in you go. That being said however, this game actually gets fun the more friends you play it with (God knows how many times I've laughed with each Character's catchphrases like a madman since I like each of them and their dialogs) and allows you to keep playing for longer without that droning feeling. Unfortunatly, that requires 4 seperate friends with 4 seperate copies who may not even want to get this in the first place, so shelling up for a 4-Pack to enjoy this game starts feeling like less of a choice and more of a demand.

As for Characters, I do like them all as I've said before. Each one comes with kill phrases" that they blurt out everytime they gib a demon or pick up something very deadly to use.

All in all

The Haunted: Hells Reach is a fast-paced survival fps made in Unreal Engine 3. You fight massive waves of enemies in a Killing floor-esque style of gameplay but in Hells Reach it feels a lot harder because enemies move faster and some have special abilities to help bring you down. In Killing Floor you often hunker down with your teammates in a choke point while in The Haunted: Hells Reach doing so normally means you all die. Sticking together & constantly moving is the key to winning here. Seperating from your team is basically suicide in the later stages when the waves have more unit variety & more aggressive enemies.

There's 12 weapons and 6 types of explosives. Each time you kill an enemy with a weapon that weapon gains experience. Each weapon can be upgraded five times and for each time you upgrade it, it changes. For example; the handgun turns into the burst pistol, vendetta revolver, akimbo handguns, akimbo burst pistols and lastly akimbo vendetta revolvers. Depending on what type of enemies you will encounter on a map it will pay off upgrading a certain weapon that you know is effective against said enemy. The ammo is limited so you have to make each shot count. Enemies will drop new ammo at random.

There is 8 maps, 9 if you count the boss level. Each map has a nice design and special layout that enables different tactics to defeat the waves of enemies you encounter. The maps each have special weather events that make it harder to survive. On Forsaken Canyon there's a thunderstorm for example. It obstructs your sight and random thunderbolts hit the ground. If you get hit you get stunned for a short time. During the time of the thunderstorm you should try to stay away from open areas - which makes it a lot harder to survive against some enemies.

There's 10 different types of enemy minions & 4 player controlled characters in the game - Caleb, Bruce, Hector & Jacob. In multiplayer they get chosen at random & they do not have any individual special abilities.

In my personal opinion I think that this was a really fun game to play cooperatively with friends. It's extremely actionpacked & brutal. Like most games in this genre it does get repetative and dull after a while but if you & your friends are looking for a game to play together for a few nights then I'd definitely recommend it. Is it worth the current price of 15€ though? 10€ perhaps. Wait for it to be on sale.

The Haunted: Hells Reach is a third person shooter
which concentrates on the Co-Op espect and I do not recommend to anyone
to play this game as a singleplayer experience.

Gameplay :
the gameplay is very simple, its a third person shooter experience in which
you mainly use a shotgun/rifle/pistol/knife and with luck you will find grandes
or other helpful weapons, also you can use a couple of nice kicks
and punches with a finishing move that kills the enemy instantly,
Your main objective is to survive waves and to kill as much of zombies/demons
as you can. After you will survive the 4 waves you will face against a boss.
While the gameplay is really simple and fun there is no denying that the game
concentrates on the Co-Op experience, so if you plan on buying this game,
buy it only if you have friends that you can play with.

Graphics :
there isn't much to say about the graphics except that you need to be reminded
that this game isn't an AAA title and its only an Indie game so don't expect to much
out of it, I personally think that the graphics are better than most of the Indie titles
out there, and watching all the blood and gore makes me realize that sometimes
realistic" graphics isn't the most important espect of a game.

Music/Sound :
Character voices are hilarious with their accent and trash talking
date:
the sound isn't something amazing or special but it does fit to the games
atmosphere. Unfortunatly the music can sometimes be a little to repeatedy.

Bugs/Glitches :
I must say that I expected to encounter alot of bugs and glitches
but luckly there aren't that many
recommended:
even so I did encounter some of them
which made me restart the game or getting stucked in the middle of map.

Summary :
The Haunted: Hells Reach is a very simple and fun game which you can
spend time with your friends. The game does have its disadvantages
like : bugs
helpfulPercent:
no value in the singleplayer and no information
about how to play or what you need to do ( or how to upgrade you weapons )
only with time you will understand how the game works.
I recommend this game to everyone who wants to play a mindless
third person shooter with your friends against  zombies and demons.
Overall I give this game a 6.5/10"

Great game! I honestly didn't expect this. When was the time you played a 3rd person shooter/beat-em-up on the PC? This game keeps it old school. No story, no character progression, no rpg elements, no classes. Basically take everything that was fused into the shooter genre in the last couple of years (perks,rpg elements,xp) and toss it out of the window. 8 stunning levels, 4 modes and hundreds of demons to kill with a combat system that fuses melee moves and shooting in an excellent blend. Liu Kang kick and a shot to the chest from a double barrel? Check. Chuck Norris roundhouse and a hail of bullets from dual uzis? Check. And all that topped with dedicated servers for multi, a level editor and millions of buckets full of blood. If you're lookin for a title that will make you feel like a human meat machine then look no further.

You are constantly on the go, evading and killing, destroying stones as well as saving your fallen comrades before their souls are stolen.  Don't stand around to long or you'll quickly end up dead as the enemies are constantly spawning in all directions.  Grade A super fast paced and frantic...that's why I like it!  :-). It's an interesting game, to say the least.

For one, it's not an easy game. it's really simple to go from killing everything in sight to being swarmed by 10 small zombies dealing massive damage to you in 3 seconds flat. each of the weapon upgrades are unique and offer different variations to how each functions. it's insanely fun to play with friends, particularly on Battle mode.

that being said, any excuse to let my inner evil warmonger out and not be a total ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ to my friends is fine by me as well; Demon mode offers a nice variation, from spawning in monsters to torture your friends, or creating mini-boss versions by controlling them yourself, breaking them away from the static AI the enemies usually have.

there are a few issues that I've seen. the fact you can't host a private game without randoms joining (mind, as of right now, very few people actively play this game online, it seems), a small issue where we tried to make one specific person the solo Demon in a Battle mode without that person being the host... but all in all, I like it.

This game is sooo addicting! I love the gun upgrading system, you start with a pistol, a shotgun, and an assault rifle. As you kill the monsters, you gain XP. When you have leveled up, the last creature you kill will drop a weapon upgrade box. Equip wjich gun you want to upgrade (i always pick the pistol first, but its 100% your choice) and pick the box up. Then BAM you have a better pistol, shotgun or assault rifle! (whichever you chose) I love the creature designas well, its SO refreshing to see NEW ideas, that haven't been used before. Because I have played Left 4 Dead 1 and 2, both Killing Floor games and both Dead Island games, and all of them have had a puking monster, a charging monster, or a screaming monster. This game does have a puking minster, but other than that, this game has new ideas, and it makes the game challenging and more versatile. Fun alone (but very challenging) but amazing to play with a friend. I still can't kill the final boss, but its still a blast!
